"Praying salah on time is called \"adaa\", praying when its time is over is called \"qadaa\". Salah which couldn't be prayed during its time is called \"faaitah\". Its plural is \"fawaait\". \n" "\n" "It's fard to pray qada of daily 5 time salahs which weren't prayed on time, and the qada of al-vitr is wajib. Number of sunnahs to do qada is few. Such, if the sunnah and the fard of salah al-fajr weren't prayed, then both the qada of sunnah and fard would be prayed during the time from 50-55 after sunrise till a little time before salah ad-dhur time. They couldn't be prayed before duha time or after istiwa. According to Imam Muhammad even if this salah(suunah of salah al-fajr) wasn't prayed on time where fard was prayed, qada of sunnah still would be done between duha and istiwa time. \n" "\n" "It's of the major sins not praying a salah on time without any excuses. Allaahu Taâlâ says: \"But when you become secure, re-establish [regular] prayer. Indeed, prayer has been decreed upon the believers a decree of specified times.\" (an-Nisa, 4/103) The sin of not praying salah on time without an excuse wouldn't be erased by qada, repentance would be necessary as well. \n" "\n" "There are some valid excuses for delaying salah. For example: Fear of enemy, or a n obstetrician fearing the death of the baby or the mother during birth, could be among these excuses. \n" "\n" "A person who delays salah knowingly due to his laziness would be a sinner and it's wajib upon him to do qada of this salah. \n" "\n" "How to do qada of salah?\n" "\n" "Qada of a salah is same as the adaa of it. For example, a person who misses a 4 rakah salah when travelling, he would do qada of it as 2 rakahs either out of town or after he turns back home. And when he misses a salah in his town, he should do qada of it fully(4 rakahs) either out of town or at home. \n" "\n" "Does it requie an order when doing qada?\n" "If the person is owner of tarteeb, he should do it in an order between qada and waqt. If he's not owner of tarteeb, he could pray waqt, before qada.\n" "\n" "A person is called \"owner of tarteeb\" if he doesn't owe qada of salah for more than 6 waqts. When he has more than 6 qada to pray including vitr, he wouldn't be owner of tarteeb anymore. \n" "\n" "If a person doesn't know the number of salah he didn't pray on time, he acts in according to the dominant opinion. If he cannot make a decision, he should pray till he believes he is free from qada. \n" "\n" "If congregational prayer(salat al-jamaah) happens to start when a person is praying qada of a salah he missed, he is not allowed to attend the congregational prayer until he completes the qada.\n" "\n" "It's more proper to do qada at home. Because making the sin seen by others is taken as dare against Janab-i Haqq and also it could set a bad example for others.\n" "\n" "Qada could be done anytime except the 3 waqt of karaat. These are: The time of sunrise, sunset and zawal(when the sun is at the highest point).\n" "\n" "It's more important to be busy with qada than nawafil. But sunnahs of daily 5 prayers are exceptional either muaqqad or ghair muaqqad. I mean it's not proper leaving sunnah and doing qada instead of sunnah. Rather doing the niyyah for sunnah is more proper. It's like this even for the prayers like duha and tahajood which there are hadiths regarding them. It's better to do the niyyah for them this way as well. Because these sunnahs complete the fards. Besides, it's not possible to recompense for them. But it's possible to recompense qada as there's not a particular time for it.\n" "\n" "It's not proper for a person who sinned by leaving fards, sacrificing sunnahs to get clear from that sin. How could it be proper leaving some fo the sunnahs and nawafil which would cause the intercession of Rasulullaah alaihissalatu wassalaam, whereas he is supposed to seek the Almighty Allaah's forgiveness by increasing his ibadah? Wouldn't it be double the fault both leaving the fards and the sunnahs? The fatwa based on opinion is this. This opinion belongs to Umar Nasuhi Bilmen.\n" "\n" "Note of Editor:\n" "\n" "Qada of salat al-fajr: 2 rakaah fard would be prayed. \n" "\n" "Qada of dhuhr: 4 rakaah fard would be prayed .\n" "\n" "Qada of asr: 4 rakaah fard would be prayed .\n" "\n" "Qada of maghreeb: 3 rakaah fard would be prayed .\n" "\n" "Qada of ishaa: 4 rakaah fard would be prayed .\n" "\n" "Qada of vitr: 3 rakaah same as vitr would be prayed.\n" "\n" "Source: Prof. Dr. Hamdi DÖNDÜREN, Ilmuhaal of Islam With Proofs p.,388-393."
